content:
Hey so I was talking a bit to @scalexm and we were thinking we'd try to setup a meeting this coming Monday to talk about the status of chalk, rust-analyzer integration, etc. I was going to propose 14:00 EST, which is 20:00 CEST if I'm not mistaken. I'm debating whether to try for zoom or zulip -- I'm probably ok for either.

Anyway, one other question would be which things are best to discuss in said meeting. I see two options:

  • dig into lazy normalization from the chalk perspective (and maybe some about rustc, too)
  • step back to look at good next steps for a bigger picture traits wg

I am to do some amount of prep for either/both
Zulip would work better for me but I can try to make Zoom work
Hey so @matklad and I have been talking over in #t-compiler/wg-rls-2.0
We are currently hacking a bit on a hackmd document trying to create the rough outlines of a plan

We had talked about having a discussion here around this time; I was supposed to create a calendar event, but I made it for sunday by accident and deleted it yesterday from my phone, then forget to create one here

The hackmd doc is focused more on the biggest picture and what we ought to work towards -- but I think there are a lot of concrete, smaller steps worth thinking over. I'm hoping to spend the rest of the day digging into some of those.
